info.title: Opc-History-Service
info.description: Azure Industrial IoT OPC UA Historic Access Service

post.summary: Delete value history at specified times
post.description: Delete value history using historic access. The endpoint must be activated and connected and the module client and server must trust each other.

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: The identifier of the activated endpoint.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The history update request

post.description: Delete historic values using historic access. The endpoint must be activated and connected and the module client and server must trust each other.

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: The identifier of the activated endpoint.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The history update request

post.description: Delete historic values using historic access. The endpoint must be activated and connected and the module client and server must trust each other.

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: The identifier of the activated endpoint.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The history update request

post.description: Delete historic events using historic access. The endpoint must be activated and connected and the module client and server must trust each other.

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: The identifier of the activated endpoint.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The history update request

post.description: Read node history if available using historic access. The endpoint must be activated and connected and the module client and server must trust each other.

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: The identifier of the activated endpoint.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The history read request

post.summary: Read next batch of history as json
post.description: Read next batch of node history values using historic access. The endpoint must be activated and connected and the module client and server must trust each other.

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: The identifier of the activated endpoint.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The history read next request

post.summary: Update node history using raw json
post.description: Update node history using historic access. The endpoint must be activated and connected and the module client and server must trust each other.

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: The identifier of the activated endpoint.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The history update request

post.description: Insert historic values using historic access. The endpoint must be activated and connected and the module client and server must trust each other.

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: The identifier of the activated endpoint.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The history insert request

post.description: Insert historic events using historic access. The endpoint must be activated and connected and the module client and server must trust each other.

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: The identifier of the activated endpoint.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The history insert request

post.description: Read historic events of a node if available using historic access. The endpoint must be activated and connected and the module client and server must trust each other.

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: The identifier of the activated endpoint.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The history read request

post.summary: Read next batch of historic events
post.description: Read next batch of historic events of a node using historic access. The endpoint must be activated and connected and the module client and server must trust each other.

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: The identifier of the activated endpoint.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The history read next request

post.description: Read processed history values of a node if available using historic access. The endpoint must be activated and connected and the module client and server must trust each other.

parameters.name: endpointId
parameters.description: The identifier of the activated endpoint.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The history read request

parameters.description: The identifier of the activated endpoint.

parameters.description: The history replace request

post.description: Replace historic events using historic access. The endpoint must be activated and connected and the module client and server must trust each other.

parameters.name: endpointId

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The history replace request

CredentialType.description: Type of credentials to use for authentication

DiagnosticsLevel.description: Level of diagnostics requested in responses

auditId.description:
Client audit log entry.
(default: client generated)

locales.description: Optional list of locales in preference order.

browsePath.description:
An optional path from NodeId instance to
the actual node.

statusCode.description: Error code - if null operation succeeded.

errorMessage.description: Error message in case of error or null.

results.description: List of results from the update operation

the actual node.

details.description:
The HistoryReadDetailsType extension object
encoded in json and containing the tunneled
Historian reader request.

indexRange.description:
Index range to read, e.g. 1:2,0:1 for 2 slices
out of a matrix or 0:1 for the first item in
an array, string or bytestring.
See 7.22 of part 4: NumericRange.

history.description: History as json encoded extension object

continuationToken.description: Continuation token if more results pending.

Continuation token to continue reading more
results.

history.description: History as json encoded extension object

continuationToken.description: Continuation token if more results pending.

browsePath.description:
An optional path from NodeId instance to
the actual node.

details.description:
The HistoryUpdateDetailsType extension object
encoded as json Variant and containing the tunneled
update request for the Historian server. The value
is updated at edge using above node address.

statusCode.description: The status code associated with the value.

sourceTimestamp.description: The source timestamp associated with the value.

sourcePicoseconds.description: Additional resolution for the source timestamp.

serverTimestamp.description: The server timestamp associated with the value.

serverPicoseconds.description: Additional resolution for the server timestamp.

browsePath.description:
An optional path from NodeId instance to
the actual node.

nodeId.description:
Type definition node id if operand is
simple or full attribute operand.

index.description:
Element reference in the outer list if
operand is an element operand

value.description: Variant value if operand is a literal

nodeId.description:
Type definition node id if operand is
simple or full attribute operand.

alias.description:
Optional alias to refer to it makeing it a
full blown attribute operand

ContentFilterElementApiModel.description: An expression element in the filter ast

filterOperands.description: The operands in the element for the operator

elements.description: The flat list of elements in the filter AST

eventFields.description: The selected fields of the event

items.description: Represents primitive or structurally complex value

An optional path from NodeId instance to

out of a matrix or 0:1 for the first item in
an array, string or bytestring.

continuationToken.description: Continuation token if more results pending.

history.description: History as json encoded extension object

continuationToken.description: Continuation token if more results pending.

startTime.description:
Beginning of period to read. Set to null
if no specific start time is specified.

endTime.description:
End of period to read. Set to null if no
specific end time is specified.

numValues.description:
The maximum number of values returned for any Node
over the time range. If only one time is specified,
the time range shall extend to return this number
of values. 0 or null indicates that there is no
maximum.

returnBounds.description: Whether to return the bounding values or not.

out of a matrix or 0:1 for the first item in
an array, string or bytestring.
See 7.22 of part 4: NumericRange.
